title: 104_hr1969
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Superfund Site Public Health Improvement Act" and focuses on public health at NPL facilities. Section 104(i)(6) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to require the Administrator of ATSDR to conduct health assessments for facilities on the National Priorities List, including those owned by the US government. The assessments must be completed before the issuance of a remedial investigation and feasibility study to consider public health implications in selecting remedial actions. The Administrator and the Administrator of ATSDR will develop strategies to gather on-site and off-site data for health assessments. ATSDR will provide recommendations for sampling hazardous substances promptly after site discovery. The Administrator will incorporate these recommendations into site investigation activities to enhance community involvement in health assessments. The Administrator of ATSDR will collect data from affected communities and sources on exposure to hazardous substances. Health assessments will be designed with input from the community, emphasizing local expertise and resources. The designs for health assessments will emphasize collecting actual exposure data and considering multiple sources of exposure. SEC. 3. HEALTH STUDIES.

The Administrator of ATSDR may conduct human health studies based on health assessments to determine the need for full-scale epidemiologic studies on exposed populations.

SEC. 4. DISTRIBUTION OF MATERIALS TO HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND MEDICAL CENTERS. Paragraph (14) of section 104(i) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to require the Administrator of ATSDR to provide educational materials on medical surveillance, screening, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of injuries or diseases related to exposure to hazardous substances to health professionals and medical centers. ATSDR will provide educational materials on human health effects of hazardous substances to the general public and at-risk populations. Section 104(i)(15) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include grants, cooperative agreements, or contracts with various entities, giving consideration to historically black colleges and universities and educational institutions serving minorities or affected communities. New subparagraphs are added at the end. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include grants, cooperative agreements, or contracts with various entities, giving consideration to historically black colleges and universities and educational institutions serving minorities or affected communities. The Administrator of ATSDR may provide assistance to entities affected by hazardous substance releases, including health services like diagnostic services, specialized treatment, and public health education. SEC. 6. Amends the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 to include public health recommendations in remedial actions.
